com.primary

Class CaesarFrame

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Frame
            • javax.swing.JFrame
              • com.primary.CaesarFrame
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants

    public class CaesarFrame
extends javax.swing.JFrame
    This is the main frame for the Caesar Cipher program. It is responsible for the input of both message and key for the process being carried out. It also let the user to select the mode and the alphabet using a friendly UI
    Version:
    2.0
    Author:
    Eng. Eduardo Basurto
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • CaesarFrame

        public CaesarFrame()
        Creates new form CaesarFrame

        Also:

        1. Initialize the components
        2. Center the frame in the screen
        3. Evaluates for the first time the message
        4. Evaluates for the first time the key
        5. Establishes the listeners for every component in the GUI
        6. Set the Caesar Cipher icon for the form

    • Method Detail

      • implementListeners

        private void implementListeners()
        Method used to implement every Listener used by the diferent components in the GUI.

      • evaluateKey

        private void evaluateKey()
        This method is in charge of evaluating the message depending on the mode selected and the alphabet

      • evaluateMessage

        private void evaluateMessage()
        This method evaluates continuosly the message(message) for the Caesar cipher. If there is a character not contained in the alhphabet, it displays an error on screen and disables the send(ENVIAR) button. If the field is empty, it just disables the button

      • notInAlphabet

        private boolean notInAlphabet(java.lang.String str)
        Method used in the evaluateMessage() method. It tells if one of the characters in your message is not contained in the alphabet or restrictedAlphabet, depending on the selected mode. It is intended to eliminate the logic errors in the cipher/decipher proces
        Parameters:
        str - The message to verify
        Returns:
        boolean True if a character doesn't existe in alphabet
